channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Coin crashes and recovers after Melania Coin launch. What’s next, for the incoming first family and the crypto industry.
item.description: The meme-coin frenzy surrounding President-elect Donald Trump’s launch saw twists and turns over the weekend following the launch of a coin celebratin...

item.title: Gold Futures Broadly Flat Ahead of Trump's Inauguration
item.description: Gold futures were broadly flat as the dollar softened, with investors seeking clarity on potential Trump policies that could affect inflation trends, ...

item.title: Dollar's Drop Shows Sensitivity to Tariff News
item.description: The dollar’s sudden drop on a WSJ report that Trump is unlikely to implement immediate tariffs shows just how sensitive the currency is to tariff news...

item.title: Is the stock market open today? Here’s what to know for Inauguration Day and MLK Day.
item.description: The two major events fall on the same day — Jan. 20 — but most closures are because of MLK Day, which is a federal holiday.

item.title: ‘I trust that my husband isn’t a gold digger’: I’m inheriting millions of dollars. My husband says I’m ‘selfish’ to keep it. Should I share it?
item.description: “I have been a stay-at-home mom for the past five years and my husband is the sole breadwinner.”

item.title: Bitcoin Hits Record, Dollar Slides Ahead of Trump's Swearing In
item.description: The new peak above $109,000 was reached Monday, and stock futures edged higher. Since Trump was elected, bitcoin has surged more than 50%.

item.title: Oil Slide Accelerates After WSJ Reports Trump Won't Impose Immediate Tariffs
item.description: Oil’s declines accelerated after the WSJ reported that Trump isn’t planning to impose new tariffs on his first day in office.

item.title: ‘I’m worried about a recession once Trump takes office’: I’m 62, earn $50,000 and have $100,000 to invest. What should I do?
Trump inauguration: Tech CEOs like Musk, Bezos and Zuckerberg score better seats than some incoming cabinet members
item.description: Companies like Amazon, Meta, Alphabet and OpenAI have donated $1 apiece to the Trump Inauguration, and their leaders are in prime spots.

item.title: Gilt Yield Rise Ahead of Tuesday's U.K. Labor Market Data
item.description: Yields on gilts climbed ahead of U.K. labor market data due Tuesday, and XTV said, “If rising wage data is confirmed, this could weigh on the BOE rate...
